column1: #Text=[0016] FIG. 1 shows the photo of the metal substrate, in our case Ru(0001) surface.

#Text=[0017] FIG. 2 illustrates the Scanning Tunneling Microscope (STM) image of clean ruthenium substrate after the cleaning process, in our case cycles of sputtering and annealing, showing no impurity on the surface.
#Text=[0018] FIG. 3 describes the Low Energy Electron Diffraction (LEED) pattern of epitaxial graphene on Ru(0001).
#Text=The sharp LEED pattern demonstrates the high-quality of the graphene by this method in macroscopy.
#Text=[0019] FIG. 4 shows the zoom-in step by step STM images of the graphene on Ru(0001).
#Text=The atomic resolution of the graphene shows the high-quality in microscopy.
#Text=[0020] FIG. 5 discloses the LEED pattern after the silicon intercalation.
#Text=The additional spot in the LEED pattern correspond to the ordered silicon on Ru(0001).
